snippet: Pennsylvania, whose 20 electoral votes have long been among the most closely watched states in the race for the White House, is now rated as leaning Democratic, according to the latest New York Times ranking of presidential battlegrounds.
abstract: Pennsylvania, whose 20 electoral votes have long been among the most closely watched states in the race for the White House, is now rated as leaning Democratic, according to the latest New York Times ranking of presidential battlegrounds.

headline.main: The Electoral Map: Pennsylvania Now Leaning Democratic
